description: Disabling a service is a normal operation, so this state should not be included in the same log statement as host that are no longer up.  A host where the service is not up on the other hand deserves a warning rather than a debug entry
title: ComputeFilter shouldn’t generate a warning for disabled hosts

Fix proposed to branch: master

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/58118
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/f1c02fbf991bdc74650b4ff45df91199237059d4

Branch:    master

commit f1c02fbf991bdc74650b4ff45df91199237059d4
Author: Phil Day <email address hidden>
Date:   Sun Nov 24 00:19:37 2013 +0000

    ComputeFilter shouldn't generate a warning for disabled hosts
    
    Disabling a service is a normal operation, so this state should
    not be included in the same log statement as a host that fails
    the service_is_up() check.
    
    A service which is enabled but not up deserved a warning rather
    than debug entry.
    
    By separating out the checks we also avoid the service check on
    disabled hosts.
    
    Change-Id: I1a398bc033ebe71f42ac117af7dae39502aceede
    Closes-Bug: 1254356
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
